body_html: Sorry for the delay! I'm trying to get a basic implementation in as soon as I can, but I'm hunting down a bizarre test failure right now. I can definitely add efficient bilinear interpolation as part of the C++ op. The underlying op will take an input tensor (a batch of images), a transformation matrix, and the size of the output, so it should be possible to get whichever output mode you need. On Thu, Dec 1, 2016 at 5:28 PM Yuxin Wu <notifications@github.com> wrote: If anyone is OK with this performance, I also had an implementation <https://github.com/ppwwyyxx/tensorpack/blob/master/tensorpack/models/image_sample.py#L45> of bilinear sampling similar to @kofd <https://github.com/kofd> but works for batch of images, which I used to learn parameterized rotation/translation. — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <#781 (comment)>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABU8HJuFUrKH6v9S1lpoBjpy_k0ovOqFks5rD0oXgaJpZM4HFgkQ> .
body_text:
Sorry for the delay! I'm trying to get a basic implementation in as soon as
I can, but I'm hunting down a bizarre test failure right now. I can
definitely add efficient bilinear interpolation as part of the C++ op. The
underlying op will take an input tensor (a batch of images), a
transformation matrix, and the size of the output, so it should be possible
to get whichever output mode you need.

On Thu, Dec 1, 2016 at 5:28 PM Yuxin Wu <notifications@github.com> wrote:

If anyone is OK with this performance, I also had an implementation
<https://github.com/ppwwyyxx/tensorpack/blob/master/tensorpack/models/image_sample.py#L45>
of bilinear sampling similar to @kofd <https://github.com/kofd> but works
for batch of images, which I used to learn parameterized
rotation/translation.




—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
<#781 (comment)>,
or mute the thread
<https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ABU8HJuFUrKH6v9S1lpoBjpy_k0ovOqFks5rD0oXgaJpZM4HFgkQ>
.
body:
Sorry for the delay! I'm trying to get a basic implementation in as soon as
I can, but I'm hunting down a bizarre test failure right now. I can
definitely add efficient bilinear interpolation as part of the C++ op. The
underlying op will take an input tensor (a batch of images), a
transformation matrix, and the size of the output, so it should be possible
to get whichever output mode you need.

On Thu, Dec 1, 2016 at 5:28 PM Yuxin Wu <notifications@github.com> wrote:

If anyone is OK with this performance, I also had an implementation
<https://github.com/ppwwyyxx/tensorpack/blob/master/tensorpack/models/image_sample.py#L45>
of bilinear sampling similar to @kofd <https://github.com/kofd> but works
for batch of images, which I used to learn parameterized
rotation/translation.




—
